vcs.name: Fresh Fund Overview
vcs.overview: Fresh Fund is an Israeli first check venture capital fund investing in early-stage startups across segments and verticals. The Fund's typical first check ranges between $250K-$1M and it continues to invest in follow-on rounds as well. To date Fresh Fund has 45 active startups in its portfolio. In addition, Fresh Fund has recently raised a new investment vehicle dedicated exclusively to defense and dual use startups, which is now actively being deployed.
vcs.locations: Marmorek St 4, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel, Israel
vcs.industries: Business Software, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Fintech & Insurtech, Industrial Technologies, Agriculture & Food Technologies, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Cyber Security, Media & Entertainment Technologies, Energy Tech, Education & Knowledge Technologies, Aerospace, Defense & HLS

vcs.name: General Catalyst Overview
vcs.overview:
General Catalyst is a venture capital firm that makes early-stage and growth equity investments. It invests in powerful, positive change that endures.

For Seed-stage companies: it backs first-time and experience founders, as well as nascent teams, at the ideation phase of enterprise and consumer solutions with Seed stage investments from $500K to $2M.

In addition, through its Early-stage practice (<$10M in revenue), it support companies at the Series A and Series B stages that are focused on new themes and industries ripe for change through innovation and digital transformation.

Through its Hatch and XIR programs, it collaborates with world-class executives to create a new business or identify an existing growth-stage business to transform with them. Through these partnerships and active company building, it can accelerate the trajectory and improve the eventual outcome of a business.

Through its growth-stage practice ($10M 100M in revenue), it partners with founders whose businesses are at an inflection point and show strong potential for meaningful scale. As a continuation of its venture expertise, through its Endurance practice ($100M+ in revenue), it partners with once-in-a-generation companies.

The firm has offices in Cambridge, MA, Palo Alto, CA and New York City.
vcs.locations: 564 University Avenue, Palo Alto, CA, USA, 434 Broadway, New York, NY, USA, 20 University Road, Cambridge, MA, USA, 14-17 Wells Mews, London, UK, South Park Street, San Francisco, CA, USA, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
vcs.industries: Fintech & Insurtech, Business Software, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Cyber Security, Retail Platforms, Media & Entertainment Technologies, Aerospace, Defense & HLS

vcs.name: Fortissimo Capital Overview
vcs.overview:
Fortissimo Capital is an Israeli private equity investment group investing primarily in Israel-related public and private technologies and industrial companies that require a capital infusion to expand their businesses. The group provides capital in special situations to facilitate expansion.

Fortissimo Capital invests in companies at various phases, including special situations, growth acceleration, turnaround, and at points of inflection in which companies require not only capital but also strategic guidance to help them navigate to success.

Fortissimo Capital typically invests in companies with the following characteristics: leading, viable technology implemented in existing products with proven sales; consistent revenue stream and a pipeline from top-tier customers; high growth market; clear potential to gain a leading market share; and, an experienced management team.

The group is composed of long-term investors seeking to partner with management to shape corporate strategy and implement a plan of execution to accelerate growth and maximize shareholder value. Fortissimo is backed by leading financial institutions including insurance companies, banks, and pension funds.
vcs.industries: Agriculture & Food Technologies, Industrial Technologies, Business Software, Education & Knowledge Technologies, Fintech & Insurtech, Health Tech & Life Sciences, Automotive & Mobility Technologies, Aerospace, Defense & HLS, Other

vcs.name: Future Energy Ventures Overview
vcs.overview: Future Energy Ventures (FEV), established in 2016, focuses on supporting start-ups that aim to advance energy transition and decarbonization. In January 2024, FEV announced the initial closing of Fund II, an SFDR Article 9 fund, targeting investments in digital and digitally-enabled climate technologies. Fund II prioritizes solutions with the potential to transform the energy sector and urban environments. Operating from Berlin, Tel Aviv, and Palo Alto, FEV offers funding and scaling opportunities through collaboration with industry and investor partners
vcs.locations: Arye Shenkar St 1, Herzliya, Israel, Silicon Valley, CA, USA, Torstraße 201, 10115 Berlin, Germany
vcs.industries: Industrial Technologies, Business Software, Cyber Security, Automotive & Mobility Technologies
